name: Arifil Mosque
description: Arifile Mosque is located in Sarail Upazila at Brahmanbaria District, Bangladesh. It was founded by Shah Arif in 1662 and its name is derived from Arif to Arifile. Locally it is known as Arail Mosque. The mosque is an example of Mughal architecture, with a combination of Bengali, Persian and Islamic influences. The Wonderful architectural techniques, styles and crafts outside the mosque may remind one, the beauty of the Taj Mahal.
